alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 1:39PM EDT until March 14 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with up to 6 inches along the western facing slopes from Backbone Ridge to the west. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph could result in areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett and Extreme Western Allegany Counties. In West Virginia, Western Grant, Western Mineral and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow squalls may impact the Interstate 68, US-219, US-48, and US-40 corridor late this afternoon into this evening. Plan for brief but sudden periods of reduced visibility and hazardous travel conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton
